body.name: Amaretto Speciale Tallow Shaving Cream

features: The original Amaretto Speciale formula that has been setting the standard of quality shaving worldwide.
Achieve a stable, thick, protective, and amazingly slick lather just like your grandfather used to use.
An intoxicating fragrance with notes of Almond, Boozy Almond Liqueur, Syrupy Dark Cherry, and Buttery Toasted Almond Biscotti.
A trusted name in wet shaving- Moon Soaps has been producing quality products since 2008.
Artisan-made in small batches with natural ingredients to ensure a shaving cream of the highest caliber.
We only test our products on family and friends, never on animals.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #585,511 in Beauty & Personal Care (See Top 100 in Beauty & Personal Care) #792 in Men's Shaving Creams

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Benefits Creates a rich, thick lather that will contribute slickness and cushion to your daily shave. Moon Soaps shaving creams will produce an incredible residual slickness making touch-ups and multiple passes a breeze. The post-shave feel is phenomenal. Your skin will feel not only smooth, but conditioned, moisturized, and free from irritation. The scent strength of Amaretto Speciale is mid-level with a light dry down that will not overpower a cologne if used after shaving.

Suggested Use Apply a ¼ tsp (+/-) of Amaretto Speciale Shaving Cream to the bottom of your shave bowl and agitate with a damp shave brush in a circular motion adding water slowly as needed (about a tsp at a time) until a thick lather with a glossy sheen is achieved. Using this amount of cream should produce enough lather for a typical 3 pass shave. Discontinue use if any irritation occurs.

Ingredients Amaretto Speciale Shaving Cream Ingredients: Water, Beef Tallow, Stearic Acid, Shea Butter, Almond Oil, Castor Oil, Potassium Hydroxide, Coconut Oil, Sodium Hydroxide, Glycerin, Fragrance Oil

Improve your technique with these tips · Best shaves are typically achieved in the morning when the skin is rested. · We recommend washing your face with warm water or wrapping it with a warm damp towel just before shaving to hydrate the whiskers- a hair that has absorbed water will cut easier than one that hasn’t! · If you are new to wet shaving, we recommend getting a shave brush with synthetic bristles. A synthetic “knot”, as it’s referred to in brush-maker speak, is far easier to deal with than a knot made of badger or boar hair and can be acquired for a very reasonable price. · Start with a damp brush, not a dripping wet brush. This will give you the ability to control how much water goes into the mix and when. · Shave with just enough pressure to maintain blade contact- let the blade do the work. And while we’re on the subject, make sure your blade is sharp! · Rinse your razor often to keep the lather channels open- a clean wet razor glides easily and efficiently. · We feel that slowing down and enjoying a traditional 3-pass shave is the ultimate way to experience Amaretto Speciale. This systematic approach to shaving will remove hair easily with far less tugging of hair follicles and blade pressure on the skin. Pass 1: shave entire face “with the grain” of hair. This is typically in a downward direction and will remove the bulk of the hair. Pass 2: shave entire face “across the grain” of hair. This is typically in the right to left direction and will further remove stubble and pick up any hairs missed on the first pass. Pass 3: shave entire face “against the grain” of hair. This is typically in an upward direction and will give you the super smooth finish we are all after. · After your shave rinse off your face and neck with cold water. This simple practice will close up your pores and help reduce irritation. · Follow up your shave with Amaretto Speciale Aftershave Splash or Balm to further moisturize, and protect.
